thread.title: Exclusive: Virtual Logic raises pre-Series A round of funding
thread.title_full: Exclusive: Virtual Logic raises pre-Series A round of funding

author: Bhawna Gupta
title: Exclusive: Virtual Logic raises pre-Series A round of funding
text:
| 0 Comments VLS provides 3D content driven interactive digital marketing platform to showcase the products 
Virtual Logic Systems Pvt Ltd (VLS), a Bangalore-based company which is into developing products using virtual reality, simulation and 3dimensional stereoscopic technologies, has raised between Rs 4-6 crore in its pre-Series A round of funding, sources privy to the development told VCCircle. 
Swarnim Multiventures, a family office that provides early stage funding, led this round of funding along with two other high-net-worth individual (HNIs) whose names could not be immediately ascertained. 
VLS, which had previously raised seed funding from few HNIs, plans to use the money for expanding its sales team as well as broaden the product. 
Founded in 2006 by Surya Prakash and Sudarshan Ramachandraiah, VLS has developed interactive 3D visualisation tools based on artificial intelligence and virtual reality. 
Prakash and Ramachandraiah, mechanical engineers from BMS College of Engineering, were working with Bangalore Endoscopic Surgery Training and Research Centre and Infosys, respectively, before founding this venture. 
VLS claims to provide first of its kind, 3D content driven interactive digital marketing platform to showcase products & services. It will soon launch the home buying and home interior design customisation portal. 
Separate email queries to VLS and Swarnim did not immediately elicit a response. 
Elbrus Capital advised VLS on the deal.
